name: 2,2'-[(2-Nitrophenyl)methylene]bis(5-methylfuran)
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2832
Reason: 2,2'-[(2-Nitrophenyl)methylene]bis(5-methylfuran) has a melting point that can be analyzed by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is furan, which has a melting point of -10.0 degrees Celsius. The presence of two phenyl groups adds approximately +20 degrees Celsius due to increasing molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. The nitro group introduces a strong withdrawing group, raising the melting point by approximately +50 degrees Celsius. The methyl group introduces a small increase due to the additional molecular weight and possible hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +2 degrees Celsius. The furan ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and pi-stacking interactions, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius.
